campaign.name: string — e.g., luma_202501_january

kpi_targets.primary_kpi: enum [ctr, vtr, open_rate, cpc, cpa, roas, conversions, revenue]

ad_groups.media_platform: string — google ads | meta ads | salesforce | youtube | criteo | ...
ad_groups.channel: string — top-level channel code from channel_taxonomy.json (e.g., 'search', 'social', 'email', 'display', 'affiliate'). use the taxonomy's canonical codes.
ad_groups.ad_placement: string — search network | ig/fb feed+stories | in-stream skippable | responsive display | inbox ...
ad_groups.ad_format: enum [text, image, video, carousel, native, other]
ad_groups.billing_type: enum [cpc, cpm, cpa, cpv, cpl, flat]
ad_groups.budget: decimal — planned for this ad group
ad_groups.actual_spend: decimal — actual for this ad group
ad_groups.ctr: number — ctr in percent units, e.g., 2.16 (not 0.0216)
ad_groups.engagement_rate: number — engagement rate in percent units
ad_groups.open_rate: number — open rate in percent units

campaign.provenance_note: de/eu channel benchmarks were applied, ≤20% noise added per metric; typical media mix (search 35%, social 25%, email 20%, display 15%, affiliate 5%) with q4 spike; ai-assisted manual curation.

google_search.notes: non-brand baseline; brand/review terms ctr↑ cpc↑

gdn_display.notes: retargeting more efficient; prospecting lower ctr

benchmark_notes.noise_policy: per line item ≤20% perturbation on cpc/ctr/vtr/open-rate
